sentence: Leo Blom is Jopie de Beer’s best friend, but has been ruined by his dirty mind.
Herman Koopman also has a filthy mind, just like Jopie de Beer, who’s a terrible flirt and absolutely girl-crazy.
Henny Mets is a nice girl with a cheerful disposition, except that she talks in a loud voice and is really childish when we’re playing outdoors.
Ilse Wagner is a nice girl with a cheerful disposition, but she’s extremely finicky and can spend hours moaning and groaning about something.
J. is a detestable, sneaky, stuck-up, two-faced gossip who thinks she’s so grown-up.
Max van de Velde is a farm boy from Medemblik, but a decent sort, as Margot would say.
Ru Stoppelmon is a short, goofy boy from Almelo who transferred to this school in the middle of the year.
J. is easily offended, bursts into tears at the slightest thing and, to top it all off, is a terrible show-off.
Werner Joseph is nice too, but all the changes taking place lately have made him too quiet, so he seems boring.
Unfortunately, Henny has a girlfriend named Beppy who’s a bad influence on her because she’s dirty and vulgar.
Jacqueline van Maarsen is supposedly my best friend, but I’ve never had a real friend.
He’s an obnoxious, two-faced, lying, sniveling little goof who has an awfully high opinion of himself.
* is a very nervous girl who’s always forgetting things, so the teachers keep assigning her extra homework as punishment.
Eefje de Jong is, in my opinion, terrific.
Maurice Coster is one of my many admirers, but pretty much of a pest.
The Rin Tin Tin movie was a big hit with my classmates.
I’ll start by saying a few things about my school and my class, beginning with the students.
Jacques Kocernoot sits behind us, next to C., and we (G. and I) laugh ourselves silly.
Leo Slager came from the same school, but isn’t as smart.
Albert de Mesquita came from the Montessori School and skipped a grade.
Harry Schaap is the most decent boy in our class.
She does very well at school, but that’s because she works so hard, not because she’s so smart.
Hanneli Goslar, or Lies as she’s called at school, is a bit on the strange side.
Sallie Springer has a filthy mind, and rumor has it that he’s gone all the way.
Miss J. always has to be right.
Nannie van Praag-Sigaar is small, funny and sensible.
Sam Salomon is one of those tough guys from across the tracks.
Appie Riem is pretty Orthodox, but a brat too.
She’s pretty smart.
But she says what she thinks, and lately I’ve come to appreciate her a great deal.
Betty Bloemendaal looks kind of poor, and I think she probably is.
She’s always touching your hair or fiddling with your buttons when she asks you something.
She’s very kind, especially to G.Z.
She lives on some obscure street in West Amsterdam, and none of us know where it is.
Emiel Bonewit is G.Z.’s admirer, but she doesn’t care.
To my great surprise, G.Z.
J. and I can’t stand each other.
And sitting next to G.Z.
I think they’re going to hold her back a year, but of course I haven’t told her that.
is the prettiest girl in our class.
She’s very rich, and has a closet full of the most adorable dresses that are way too old for her.
At first I thought Jacque would be one, but I was badly mistaken.
She’s really got Jacque under her spell, and that’s a shame.
Rob Cohen used to be in love with me too, but I can’t stand him anymore.
He’s pretty boring.
They say she can’t stand me, but I don’t care, since I don’t like her much either.
She’s very smart, but lazy.
Still, I think he’s terrific, because he’s very funny.
She has a nice face, but is kind of dumb.
I got two brooches, a bookmark and two books.
G.Z.
He’s really smart.
wasn’t held back a year after all.
She’s pretty quiet.
She’s usually shy—outspoken at home, but reserved around other people.
There isn’t much else you can say about Nannie.
Ilse likes me a lot.
She blabs whatever you tell her to her mother.
A real brat.
I had my birthday party on Sunday afternoon.
There’s a lot to be said about the boys, or maybe not so much after all.
J.R.—I could write a whole book about her.
talks so much it isn’t funny.
I think she’s nice.
Though she’s only twelve, she’s quite the lady.
She thinks she’s gorgeous, but she’s not.
is the last of us twelve girls, me.
She’s also very helpful, and I like her.
does whatever he’s not supposed to.
She acts as if I were a baby.
He’s nice.
D.Q.
E.S.
(Admirer!)
C.N.
